main event: A man reported seeing a bright, silver star-like object in the sky for over an hour in Kettering, Ohio in 1968.
interesting points: The object was described as brighter and larger than the brightest stars.
The object was observed continuously for over 1 hour and 23 minutes.
The object was described as a bright white, small reddish-pink object that appeared to be stable in the sky.
The witness estimated the object was around a mile away and moving at around 50 mph.
The witness drew a diagram showing the object's path and position in the sky during the sighting.
sighted object: A bright, silver star-like object in the sky
